definition:
The coefficient of $x^{n-k}$ in the polynomial
$(x+t_1) (x+t_2) \cdots (x+t_n)$ is called the $k^\mathrm{th}$
*elementary symmetric polynomial* in the $n$ variables
$t_1, \dots, t_n$. The elementary symmetric polynomials can also be
constructed by taking the sum of all possible degree $k$ monomials in
$t_1,\dots, t_n$ having distinct factors.

The first few examples are:

$n=1$:

:   $
    \begin{array}{l}
    t_1
    \end{array}
    $

$n=2$:

:   $
    \begin{array}{l}
     t_1 + t_2\\
     t_1 t_2
    \end{array}
    $

$n=3$:

:   $
    \begin{array}{l}
     t_1 + t_2 + t_3\\
     t_1 t_2 + t_2 t_3 + t_1 t_3\\
     t_1 t_2 t_3
    \end{array}
    $
